content:
# The smelting process has successfully produced 5 copper plates in the furnace, bringing my total to 5 copper plates.
# However, I still need more copper plates to craft the necessary copper cables and electronic circuits.

# My current inventory now consists of:
# - 6 wood
# - 5 stone
# - 5 iron ore
# - 10 copper ore (remaining)
# - 9 iron plates
# - 1 copper cable
# - 3 electronic circuits

# To craft more copper cables, I need to smelt more copper ore into copper plates. 
# I will insert more copper ore into the furnace for smelting.

# Let's insert more copper ore into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.Wood, furnace, quantity=2)  # Inserting wood as fuel
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, furnace, quantity=5)  # Inserting additional copper ore to smelt

# Check inventory after these operations
print(f"Inventory after inserting additional copper ore into the furnace: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Furnace status after inserting copper ore: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")

# Wait for the smelting process to finish
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    copper_plates = inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.CopperPlate]
    if copper_plates >= 5:  # Check if we have enough copper plates produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# Check the inventory after smelting
print(f"Inventory after smelting additional copper ore: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")
